an2.164-179:1: "Bhikkhus, there are these two qualities. What two? (64) Rectitude and gentleness … (65) Patience and mildness … (66) Softness of speech and hospitality … (67) Harmlessness and purity … (68) Not guarding the doors of the sense faculties and immoderation in eating … (69) Guarding the doors of the sense faculties and moderation in eating … (70) The power of reflection and the power of development … (7) The power of mindfulness and the power of concentration …… (72) Serenity and insight … (73) Failure in virtuous behavior and failure in view … (74) Accomplishment of virtuous behavior and accomplishment of view … (75) Purity of virtuous behavior and purity of view … (76) Purity of view and striving in accordance with one's view … (77) Non-contentment in regard to wholesome qualities and indefatigability in striving … (78) Muddle-mindedness and lack of clear comprehension … (79) Mindfulness and clear comprehension. These are the two qualities."
